problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Cuboidal epithelium is specialized for
problems.hint: Think of the surface area to volume ratio
problems.detailed: The correct answer is D. Cuboidal epithelia have a balanced surface area and volume, so they have enough volume to contain necessary structures (Golgi apparatus and endoplasmic reticulum) while having enough surface area for secretion of substances.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following is an organ where cuboidal epithelium would be found?
problems.hint: Think of parts of the body that deal with secreting substances.
problems.detailed: The correct option is A, the thyroid secretes thyroid hormone. The other organs do not secrete substances as much.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following epithelial cells is important for diffusion?
problems.hint: It has to be very thin, and plate-like for diffusion to occur easily.
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option D, simple squamous epithelia are plate-like and specialized for diffusion. They would likely be found in blood vessels and lungs where gas exchange is important.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: What type of epithelia is typically found lining the intestines?
problems.hint: It cannot be simple squamous epithelium, as they are found in THIN areas with lots of diffusion. Focus on something that will be good at absorption.
problems.detailed: Simple columnar epithelium are found in areas important in secretion and/or absorption, like the intestines.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which option best describes pseudostratified columnar epithelium?
options: One layer of cells without nuclei
One layer of cells with nuclei at different heights
Only nuclei stacked on top of one another
problems.hint: Nuclei cannot exist on their own outside of the cell.
problems.detailed: Pseudostratidies columnar epithelium are made out of a single layer of cells with nuclei placed at different heights.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following correctly identifies the two types of cells in connective tissue?
problems.hint: Eosinophils are specialized immune cells targeting parasites. They are also released during allergic reactions.
problems.detailed: The two types of cells in connective tissue are macrophages and fibroblasts. Macrophages engulf foreign particles as a part of the immune system, and fibroblasts secrete fibre proteins.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of connective tissue?
problems.detailed: Neurons are part of the nervous system, they are specialized to conduct electrical signals - they are NOT a type of connective tissue.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following is INCORRECT?
options: Cardiac muscle is found in the contractile wall of the heart
Smooth tissue has intercalated discs that send signals
Skeletal muscle is responsible for voluntary contractions
Glial cells support neurons by nourishing and insulating them
problems.hint: Smooth muscle does not need to send signals
problems.detailed: Cardiac muscle, not smooth muscle has intercalated discs to send signals.
